topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Migrate an Instance

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack® Carrier Grade (Alpha): Resizing Instances

body.p: Users can migrate or live migrate an instance as needed.

Migration enables an administrator to move a virtual-machine instance from one compute host to another. This feature is useful when a compute host requires maintenance. Migration can also be useful to redistribute the load when many VM instances are running on a specific physical machine.

li.p: Migration. The instance is shut down for a period of time to be moved to another hypervisor. In this case, the instance recognizes that it was rebooted.
Live migration. Almost no instance downtime. Useful when the instances must be kept running during the migration.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Helion Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Migrate Instance.
In the Confirm Migrate Instance screen, select Migrate Instance.
Refer to teh Flavor Details list for information on the selected falvor.
The Total RAM meter under Project Limits will show how the resized instance affects the RAM allocated for the project.
